edu.mit.jwi.data
Class FileProvider

java.lang.Object
  edu.mit.jwi.data.FileProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDataProvider
public class FileProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDataProvider

A basic implementation of the IDataProvider interface that uses files in the file system to back instances of IDictionaryDataSource. It takes a url to a filesystem directory as its path argument, and uses the hints from the getResourceNameHints() methods on the IPartOfSpeech and IDictionaryDataSourceType interfaces to examine the filenames in the that directory to determine which files contain which data.

The

This version has been confirmed to work with both Wordnet versions 2.1 and 3.0, in both Windows and UNIX versions.

Since:
1.5.0
Version:
1.1, 04/28/07
Author:
Mark A. Finlayson

Method Detail

setSource

public void setSource(java.net.URL url)
Description copied from interface: IDataProvider
The dictionary (or user) that is using the file provider must call this method with the appropriate url that directs the file provider to the data that backs the dictionary. If the data provider has already been opened, this call will have no effect until the provider is closed then opended again.

Specified by:
setSource in interface IDataProvider

          throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: IDataProvider
Instructs the file provider to perform any initialization, such as creating IDictionaryDataSource objects and registering them with the appropriate IContentType.

Specified by:
open in interface IDataProvider
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the dictionary directory does not exist or the directory is empty, or there is a problem with a file

checkOpen

protected void checkOpen()

getDirectoryHandle

public java.io.File getDirectoryHandle()
                                throws java.io.IOException
Translates the source URL into a java File object for access to the local filesystem. The URL must be in a UTF-8 compatible format as specified in URLDecoder

Returns:
A File object pointing to the Wordnet dictionary data directory.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if url is null
java.io.IOException - if url does not use the 'file' protocol

containsOneOf

protected boolean containsOneOf(java.lang.String string,
                                java.lang.String[] patterns)
Checks to see if one of the string patterns specified is found in the string. If so, returns true. It will also return true if the pattern array is non-null, but is of zero length. If neither of these conditions holds, it returns false.

close

public void close()
Description copied from interface: IDataProvider
Instructs the provider to dispose of handles to current IDictionaryDataSource objects and perform any other operations necessary to free the data resources that back the dictionary. A subsequent call to openFiles() should put the provider in a state where it can again provide file handles.

Specified by:
close in interface IDataProvider

isOpen

public boolean isOpen()
Description copied from interface: IDataProvider
Returns true if the provider has finished all of its initialization activities and is ready to return IDictionaryDataSources on command; returns false otherwise.

Specified by:
isOpen in interface IDataProvider

getFile

public IDictionaryDataSource getFile(IContentType type)
Description copied from interface: IDataProvider
Gets an IDictionaryDataSource object that is registered to the specified content type. If there is more than one IDictionaryDataSource registered to the content type, the file provider must decide, on the basis of some other information (unspecified in this interface), which file to return.

Specified by:
getFile in interface IDataProvider

registerFile

public void registerFile(IDictionaryDataSource file,
                         IContentType type)
Description copied from interface: IDataProvider
Registers the specified file to the specified content type. In many implementations this will replace the currently registered file, but need not necessarily be the case.

Specified by:
registerFile in interface IDataProvider

getAllFiles

public IDictionaryDataSource[] getAllFiles()
Description copied from interface: IDataProvider
Returns an array that contains all IDictionaryDataSource objects to which the file provider has access. Modifying the returned array should not change the handles of the file provider; modifying the IDictionaryDataSource objects, however, will change the state of those objects used by the file provider.

Specified by:
getAllFiles in interface IDataProvider

iterator

public java.util.Iterator<IDictionaryDataSource> iterator()
Description copied from interface: IDataProvider
Returns an iterator that will iterator, in no particular order, over the IDictionaryDataSources to which the file provider has access.

Specified by:
iterator in interface IDataProvider
